titlestmt.titleproper: Life After the Ford Foundation (LAFF) Society collection
Guide to the Life After the Ford Foundation (LAFF) Society collection FA1424
titlestmt.author: Katie Martin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-02-17 11:04:23 -0500.

did.unittitle: Life After the Ford Foundation (LAFF) Society collection

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Life After the Ford Foundation (LAFF) Society

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Life After the Ford Foundation (LAFF) Society collection contains clippings, LAFF directories, correspondence from LAFF members (relating to dues, former Ford contacts, and life updates), correspondence between LAFF leadership, LAFF Society newsletters from 1991-2016, and correspondence regarding LAFF newsletter editorial choices.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Life After the Ford Foundation (LAFF) Society collection is arranged into two series:
1. Life After the Ford Foundation (LAFF) Society Membership Correspondence
2. Life After the Ford Foundation (LAFF) Society Newsletters

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to RAC in 2016 and 2017 by the Life After Ford Foundation (LAFF) Society and ingested by RAC as Accessions 2016:058 and 2017:011.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The LAFF (Life After Ford Foundation) Society is an independent, volunteer-led association made up of members who worked for the Ford Foundation. The Society was formed in 1991 by former staff members, led by Edward Meade, Jr. and Richard Magat. LAFF is one of the first "alumni groups" comprised of former staff of a philanthropic foundation.

The membership of LAFF is made up of more than 480 former Ford Foundation staff from the New York and international offices. There are also local offices in Boston, New York and Washington in the United States, and overseas in Bangkok, Beijing, Cairo, Jakarta, Manila and New Delhi.
